name: Cnc-rasterfahrer-3
tagline: convert pixel bitmap image to g-code for cnc-mills
body:
![this should have been an image of the Rasterfahrer Interface](http://interaction-design-group.de/toolbox/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/screenshot_diag1.jpg)

### you have got a desktop cnc mill?

then take your last weekend trip photos and cnc-drill them to art or scratch a scanned treasure map into rusty scrap metal. The rasterfahrer can convert most bitmap images to G-code. G-code is the cnc-mill mashine code.

### how to use
You will need the processing SDK from [processing.org](https://processing.org/download/) to compile the source code. 
Then download the zip or tar file.
Copy the rasterfahrer and the library folder into your processing sketchbook folder.
Open the rasterfahrer in processing and run it.
Now load your image, slide the sliders, hit the buttons and export your ready to use G-code.

### features
drill dot patterns
line patterns
edge detection patterns
noise, to look less computer generated

### Author
benjamin kiesewetter 2013
[noviquitaeten.de](http://www.noviquitaeten.de/portfolio.php)

I am a student of the _Institute Industrial Design_ at the _University of applied sciences Magdeburg_, Germany. If you understand German and take interest in more Interaction design projects visit the [our interaction design group webpage](http://interaction-design-group.de/toolbox/?p=8496).





oh github, what is that supposed to mean?
```
$ cd noviquitaeten/cnc-rasterfahrer-3
$ git fetch origin
$ git checkout gh-pages
```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
